title: Tweetbot and Twitterrific Face the Cliff

last_post.content:
The fine folks at Tapbots and the Iconfactory need your help.

If you were a subscriber to either Tweetbot or Twitteriffic, please re-install the app and click the button to decline your refund.

It's difficult, perhaps, to understand what a huge impact this would make on these folks, but your effort and small monetary sacrifice will help them more than you know.

More details in Daring Fireball's post: https://daringfireball.net/2023/03/tweetbot_and_twitterrific_face_the_cliff

title: pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.2301...

last_post.content: this is incredible. Hanging solar panels a few meters above crops of tomatoes and jalapeños multiplied their yield 2-3x, used substantially less water, controlled temperatures, and increased the output of the solar panels https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.2301355120 #science #solar #environment #agriculture

title: Hugo Reinert (@hugo@assemblag.es)

last_post.content:
I've talked about this in smaller contexts, but I haven't found any traction and time is getting short. When the Nazis passed the enabling laws for the book burning on April 8th, 1933 — exactly 90 years ago in 34 days — the first thing they burnt, the same day, were the archives of the largest trans and gay research institute in the world. When they say now that we didn't exist until after the war, the only reason they can get away with it is that they burned all the accumulated evidence.

https://assemblag.es/@hugo/109972631252644527

title: After Alaska Airlines planes bump runway, a scramble to ‘pull the plug’

last_post.content:
“On the morning of Jan. 26, as two Alaska Airlines flights from Seattle to Hawaii lifted off six minutes apart, the pilots each felt a slight bump and the flight attendants at the back of the cabin heard a scraping noise […] Alaska’s flight operations staff quickly realized that a software bug was sending bad takeoff weight data to its crews.”

https://www.seattletimes.com/business/boeing-aerospace/after-alaska-airlines-planes-bump-runway-a-scramble-to-pull-the-plug/

title: Zotero | Zotero Expert

last_post.content:
#Zotero is hiring for a whole bunch of positions, including an accessibility dev, a new translator dev, and community expert: https://www.zotero.org/jobs/zotero_expert
Especially the latter two positions interact w a lot of the (volunteer) work I do, so would love for nice people to apply. Salary ranges are listed & seem quite competitive. Most of the jobs are open internationally.

title: core-js/2023-02-14-so-whats-next.md at master · zloirock/core-js

last_post.content:
I read something like this and it's heartbreaking.

This is literally the guy in that XKCD comic that maintains a tiny piece at the bottom of a huge JavaScript stack that would fall over if he just stopped maintaining his open source library for free one day.

And because he's not a good self-promoter, whenever he tries to ask for money all he gets is hate and vitriol in response.

Open source, man. I love it, but the tech industry sucks.

https://github.com/zloirock/core-js/blob/master/docs/2023-02-14-so-whats-next.md

title: Mastodon References for Astronomers on Twitter - @TrueSciPhi

last_post.content:
Looking for more science & math on Mastodon?

Astronomers w/ >100 followers: https://truesciphi.org/ast_mas.html

Physicists w/ >100 followers: https://truesciphi.org/phy_mas.html

Science writers w/>500 followers: https://truesciphi.org/psw_mas.html

Mathematicians w/ >100 followers: https://truesciphi.org/mat_mas.html

As relatively new low-threshold lists seeded from Twitter, many accounts likely are missing. I'm happy to receive suggestions for additions by public or private reply. Inclusion criteria are linked at the top of each list.

title: The retention problem: Women are going into tech but are also being driven out

last_post.content:
“Women make up only 9.8% of the people who contribute to open-source software projects. . . . our research found that women’s negative experiences range from minor to severe harassment, sexism, discrimination and misogyny to explicit death threats. Their expertise is challenged, their contributions are not well-received and their roles are diminished.” - Vandana Singh

last_post.content:
I'm still looking for a job! Please help me with this however you can! I'm doing what I can on my end, but recommendations/referrals do help a lot! :aliceweh:​

Comp sci degree
1.5 years as a software test engineer
Python and NodeJS for my relevant experince, but I'm a fast learner and know a few others as well
Same field, full stack web dev, sysadmin, or dev ops stuff is right up my alley
Looking for remote, but can commute (Minneapolis/St. Paul, MN, USA)
I'm a trans woman, so clear acceptance/queer coworkers are a huge plus

Entry level would be best, I don't have enough work experience for most places to look at me mid-level. DM for a resume or any questions, take a look at my site for some examples of things I do!
https://werefox.cafe

Thanks so much for all of y'all's continued support! :aliceheartblack:

title: "Transgenderism should be eradicated from public life, entirely."

last_post.content:
#transphobia #genocide #cpac #recycled_nazism

85 years ago, under the German Nazi regime, the Institute of Forensic Medicine recommended that the “phenomena of transvestism” be “exterminated from public life.”

A few days ago US conservative Michael Knowles said, live streamed from the CPAC 2023 conference in the USA, that “transgenderism must be eliminated from public life entirely,” in an eerie, almost word-for-word, echo of Nazi Germany.

title: The impact of satellite trails on Hubble Space Telescope observations - Nature Astronomy

last_post.content:
New paper day:

Just published in @NatureAstronomy, a study by @sandorkruk et al. on the increasing impact of satellite trails on Hubble & other low-Earth orbit space observatories.

We found a doubling in the number of trails per image from 2002–2021, with a significant rise of ~50% in 2021 alone, as the "megaconstellations" started to appear.

1/

#Astrodon #Astronomy #LightPollution

https://www.nature.com/articles/s41550-023-01903-3

title: Let Wikipedia Be Your Guide With Non-Sketchy News Search (NSNS) - ResearchBuzz Search Gizmos

last_post.content:
I've been trying to crack the problem of crappy #Google #news #search. After lots of trying I've made a solution I quite like: Non-Sketchy News Search.

It uses keyword searching of #Wikipedia to find media categories, then lets you choose outlets from a category to include in a Google search (using site:)

Give it a try. It's free, no ads except for Patreon banner.

*Might not work on your phone, I only code on desktop.*

https://searchgizmos.com/nsns/

title: https://blahaj.zone/tags/trans

last_post.content:
I want the cis people in my followers list to see this.

Just this weekend, in the US, at the Conservative Political Action Conference, one of the speakers at the event called for the eradication of trans people from daily life.

Eradication. There were no euphemisms, just an outright call for genocide.

That is where we are heading.

Australia is lucky. We aren't as far down that pipeline as the US, but we are going that way.

The trans people in your life are terrified. We need your help, we need your voices. This isn't a theoretical issue, or a future issue. It's right here, and it's right now.

Help us

#trans #transgender #uspol #pol #auspol

title: Pluralistic: Solving the Moderator’s Trilemma with Federation (04 Mar 2023) – Pluralistic: Daily links from Cory Doctorow

last_post.content:
This whole article from @pluralistic is great:

“Rozenshtein proposes a solution (of sorts) to the Moderator's Trilemma: federation. De-siloing social media, breaking it out of centralized walled gardens and recomposing it as a bunch of small servers run by a diversity of operators with a diversity of content moderation approaches. The #Fediverse, in other words.”

title: LastPass says employee’s home computer was hacked and corporate vault taken

last_post.content:
As advised previously, all LastPass users should change their master passwords and all passwords stored in their vaults, because while it’s not clear whether the threat actor has access to either, the precautions are certainly warranted.

Matcha smoothies and foosball tables at the office are perks, WaPo. Tenure is not a perk. Tenure protects the academic freedom of professors from fascists like Ron DeSantis and his fellow thought police in the GOP.

Florida bills would ban gender studies, transgender pronouns, tenure perks

title: Gwyneth Windflower

last_post.content:
i wrote a short article about what’s changing in the data ecosystem, and how metaphors can help us think about it. particularly how data is becoming less like a glacier we need to carve ice from and more like a vibrant watershed we can nurture.

let me know what you think, i hope it ignites some sparks of imagination about the coming developments in the data space.

https://www.gwenwindflower.com/blog/2

title: Fighting reviewer fatigue or amplifying bias? Considerations and recommendations for use of ChatGPT and other Large Language Models in scholarly peer review

last_post.content:
Good start on a hard question — how or whether to use #AI tools in #PeerReview.
https://www.researchsquare.com/article/rs-2587766/v1

"For the moment, we recommend that if #LLMs are used to write scholarly reviews, reviewers should disclose their use and accept full responsibility for their reports’ accuracy, tone, reasoning and originality."

PS: "For the moment" these tools can help reviewers string words together, not judge quality. We have good reasons to seek evaluative comments from human experts.

title: How to help someone use a computer

last_post.content:
@steve @timnitGebru I think about him a lot as well. He had one of the fundamental documents to my work (helping people learn how to use computers) and I refer to it probably weekly even though it was written in 1996. https://pages.gseis.ucla.edu/faculty/agre/how-to-help.html
As he says on his copyright page "Nobody is born with these skills, they are rarely taught, and unequal access to them is an unnecessary force for inequality"

title: carlbergstrom.com/upload/birds...

last_post.content:
I took this photo this afternoon, a five minute walk from my house. I'm in awe that I live so close to such natural beauty.

This is a young double-crested cormorant.

#birdphotography #birding #birdwatching

This one is really worth seeing in higher resolution than mastodon allows. Here's the full-size image: http://carlbergstrom.com/upload/birds/double-crested-cormorant-large.jpg
